description: A massive stone bridge in the East Blue that has been under construction for 700 years using slave labor. It is one of four similar mega-structures (along with Vodka Wolf, Rum Wolf, and Bourbon Wolf) built by order of the World Nobles.

keyEvents.title: Robin Imprisoned at Tequila Wolf
keyEvents.description: Robin is held prisoner at the Tequila Wolf Prison Tower, forced into slave labor on the bridge construction project.
keyEvents.significance: Shows the harsh reality of the World Government's slave labor system and Robin's dire situation.

keyEvents.title: Revolutionary Army Attacks Tequila Wolf
keyEvents.description: The Revolutionary Army led by Bunny Joe launches a liberation assault on Tequila Wolf, freeing all enslaved workers.
keyEvents.significance: Demonstrates the Revolutionary Army's commitment to fighting the World Government's oppression and their search for Robin.

statusHistory.reason: Bridge has been under construction for 700 years using slave labor
Revolutionary Army freed all slaves temporarily

name.japanese: テキーラウルフ監獄塔

description: A prison tower at Tequila Wolf where captured or troublesome slaves are held and interrogated. Prisoners are fitted with Seastone armlets to nullify Devil Fruit powers.

keyEvents.title: Robin Imprisoned
keyEvents.description: Robin is held in the Prison Tower wearing Seastone armlets while being interrogated about allegedly sinking six ships.
keyEvents.significance: First appearance of this specific location, showing the brutal interrogation methods used at Tequila Wolf.

keyEvents.title: Soran Visits Robin
keyEvents.description: Soran, an enslaved girl, visits Robin in the Prison Tower to share sweets with her.
keyEvents.significance: Shows the bonds formed between enslaved workers despite the harsh conditions.

statusHistory.reason: Operating as a prison for Tequila Wolf
Destroyed or abandoned during Revolutionary Army attack

description: An archipelago of flower-shaped islands in Paradise. The islands are actually giant carnivorous plants known as 'Stomach Barons' that lure prey with abundant food before consuming them. The archipelago is home to unique plant species called Pop Greens.

keyEvents.title: Island's True Nature Revealed
keyEvents.description: The episode reveals that the Boin Archipelago islands are actually massive carnivorous plants called Stomach Barons that trap and consume prey.
keyEvents.significance: Explains the dangerous ecosystem of the archipelago and the true threat Usopp faces.

description: One of the islands in the Boin Archipelago, featuring the Forest of Gluttony. The island is actually a giant carnivorous plant (Stomach Baron) that uses its abundant food to lure and fatten prey before consuming them.

keyEvents.title: Usopp on Greenstone Island
keyEvents.description: Usopp is shown struggling to survive on Greenstone Island, being chased by man-eating plants including large walking sunflowers.
keyEvents.significance: Establishes the dangerous environment where Usopp will spend the next two years training.

keyEvents.title: Island Attempts to Consume Prey
keyEvents.description: Greenstone Island closes its leaves to consume everything inside, revealing its true nature as a carnivorous Stomach Baron plant.
keyEvents.significance: Shows the island's feeding mechanism and the constant danger inhabitants face.

description: A section of Greenstone Island filled with abundant, delicious ready-to-eat food including plum trees, corn stalks, and rivers of prepared ramen. It serves as a trap to fatten up prey before the island consumes them. Despite the danger, it also contains rare Pop Green plants.

keyEvents.title: Usopp Discovers the Forest of Gluttony
keyEvents.description: Heracles leads Usopp to the Forest of Gluttony, an area filled with delicious ready-to-eat food. Usopp begins eating ravenously after being starved.
keyEvents.significance: Introduces the deceptive paradise that serves as the island's trap and Usopp's future training ground.

keyEvents.title: Usopp Succumbs to Gluttony
keyEvents.description: Usopp becomes extremely overweight from overeating in the Forest of Gluttony, showing his lack of discipline.
keyEvents.significance: Demonstrates the forest's trap mechanism and Usopp's initial weakness that he must overcome.

statusHistory.reason: Forest actively luring prey with abundant food
